channel.title: Virgin media and the superhub
channel.description:
Recently I've been having connection issues to my not so super hub in fact my whole family have been having problems. It's unlikely but is anyone else having problems like the following:
Random disconnections when performing certain downloads. Very bad download and upload speeds when you actually pay for 100mb connection.
I know a lot of you are American and probably wont use virgin so I could be wasting my time but whatever. Oh and please don't tell me to contact customer support because it is absolute shit: you always speak to foreign people who don't know anything except the bullshit they read of the scripts their given( I don't mean to offend anyone).

item.title: Virgin media and the superhub
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

The thing is it’s like there’s a cap on the amount I can download in a certain time. I have unlimited bandwidth and unlimited downloads but whenever I try to download a simple thing like winrar it downloads for a second then when It gets to like 800kb/s the download stops and my internet connection goes and then comes back.

Ollie - Have you ever had problems with customer support from virgin?

Read full topic

item.title: Virgin media and the superhub
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Probably nothing related, but I too have Virgin Media (50MB) and have been having intermittent connection issues within the past few days. I don’t have a superhub though.

Read full topic

item.title: Virgin media and the superhub
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

if your family lives in the same area as you, you (or someone else) needs to contact virgin and tell there are troubles in the area where you live and they’ll fix it

Read full topic
